Posts.Content: "Partial breast radiation"? Are you referring to mammosite HDR? Whole breast radiation is also available with HDR - brachytherapy. I had the whole breast brachytherapy and it was a breeze. 20 catheters used, 5 days of treatments and no pain whatsoever - and, felt nothing when the catheters removed - no numbing necessary - just clipped and pulled out with no feeling. The parameters for this type radiation are very narrow, and I feel truly blessed to have had the opportunity. Chemo wasn't recommended for me, just the rads. Good Luck!
Posts.Title: Accelerated Partial Breast Irradiation

Posts.Content: visit www.serenecomfort.com for information about sleepwear and sheets to help with night sweats.  I've been exempt from these so far after almost 3 years on Arimidex, but have heard wonderful things from other survivors on other sites.  Every single post was very pleased with the $$ spent and said it really made a difference in their life.  Doesn't hurt to try.  The side effects I have from the Rx is hair thinning and swollen knuckles in my hands.  But, as an earlier post said, I can deal with these things in view of the fact it's supposed to help us guard again recurrence.  With bilateral IDC occurring at exactly the same time, I'm willing to do a lot to dance with NED.  Good Luck!
Posts.Title: side effects of arimidex

Posts.Content: visit breastcancer.org and you'll find thousands of survivors and their stories.
Posts.Title: not quite knowledgeable... but I need some help

Posts.Content: Hello.  I am a 31 month survivor of bilateral IDC/lumpectomies/HDR brachytherapy to the left and been on arimidex 28 months. (from diagnosis to end of treatment was 63 days).  I was 62 at Dx and in very good health.  Please don't let the horror stories of Arimidex side effects scare you.  Each person is different as are their daily Rx intake that may be affected by Arimidex.  The only changes I've noticed are thinning hair (which stopped after the first 6 months) and swelling in thumb and 1st 2 fingers of (r) hand and 1st joint of pinkie finger on the left.  Mobic (antiflammatory) keeps the swelling and stiffness down for me - cannot take Aleve or Ibuprofen.  Small trade-off if it gives better odds against recurrence, is my thinking.  Good Luck!  And, there are other AIs available if your body does not tolerate Arimidex.
Posts.Title: arimidex~side effects

Posts.Content: Research!  I've walked the path you travel in 2004 (bilateral) and did the HDR brachytherapy and now Arimidex.  Chemo wasn't offered due to clear margins and clear lymph nodes.  BUT I can tell you I would have thought long and hard about chemo - I follow your problems with sensitivity to many Rxs and also external rads were a great fear.  Very sensitive skin.  If it had been recommended with 4% over the already 85% prevention against recurrence after treatment, I would have said no.  I'm 31 months post treatment and never looked back.  4 month checkups the first 24 months and constant tests are a bit of a downer, but now I've graduated to every 6 months.  And, I won't miss a test.  None of us has a guarantee against recurrance, but we have to determine 'quality of life -v- quantity of life'.  Each one has to make their own decisions and if it works out that's great; if it doesn't work out doesn't mean we made a mistake to me - just that it was in His plan and we have to start again from point B.  Good Luck!
Posts.Title: Difficult Personal Decision

Posts.Content: 18 monts post bilateral lumpectomies with brachytherapy to the left and Rx Arimidex currently. 2nd 6 month mammogram show microcalifications (2). Radio said wait 6 months before any biopsy. 3rd 6 month mammogram 2 more showing, but not clustered. Grains of salt. Stereotactic biopsy and pathology came back benign. Appears that dead cancer cells (from radiation) don't all get thrown out with the garbage and it takes time for the body to absorb the dead cells or sluff them out. When the remain for long periods of time, they calcify. So, panic attack was short. Radiologist was 'almost' sure it was okay, but wanted to be sure. ME TOO! I always want to be sure and will keep up with testing. Have faith!
Posts.Title: Breast Calcification

Posts.Content: Hi: Bilateral IDC with lumpectomies and HDR brachytherapy (L only) and on Arimidex since 09/04. Node neg;ER/PR++. Since original surgery in 08/04 I had labs and chest xray every 3 months the 1st year + full body CT scan (just before surgery), and annually ever since. Checkups with Oncologist are now every 6 months w/labs and chest xray and I have mammograms every 6 months (and will continue for next 5 years). In Feb. '06 had stereotactic biopsy for microcalcifications in L side; benign and determined dead cancer cells that hadn't flushed from rads - titanium marker placed. Mammogram in July was clean. Next CT scan is in a couple of weeks. The re-testing is nerve wracking, but I feel SO much better after each one. NED is wonderful terminology, but even 2+ years out reassurance is calming. You never can close the door on cancer. I won the battle, but the War goes on. Now it's up to me (and the Good Lord) to do everything I can to prevent recurrence and 'no more surprises'. Good Luck on your Journey.
Posts.Title: Scans After Completing Treatment For Breast Cancer?

Posts.Content: visit www.cancercenter.com I'm 62 years old and I had bilateral infiltrating ductal carcinoma and bilateral lumpectomies a month ago. I leave tomorrow for brachytherapy to the left breast. The right breast - the cancer was so small they decided radiation not necessary on that side; and sentinel nodes on both sides were clear. They took sentinel on right and sentinel on left + 2 axillary to be sure. brachytherapy is the best option for me because I have very sensitive skin and external radiation would be very difficult. Internal radiation, brachytherapy, is not available for everyone. depends on size, stage, pathology after surgery, and mets to lymph nodes. I was very, very lucky. But am following recommendations of CTCA physicians. I will also be on Amerivest hormone therapy indefinitely to supress estrogen. Estrogen is necessary for breast cancer to exist. Unfortunately, I was on estrogen replacement Rx for 12 years non-stop. They don't say this is the cause, but oncologists I have talked to say it's not a good plan. I had no menopause symptoms - just prescribed the Rx because it was supposed to ward off osteoporosis. Hold tightly to your faith and loved ones. I wish you luck and will be praying for you.
Posts.Title: Dcsi & The Need For Radiation Following a Lumpectomy

Posts.Content: visit www.breastcancer.org and you find lots of support and answers. May God walk beside you!
Posts.Title: new diagnosis, anyone similar?

Posts.Content: Request your physician order ultrasound and/or MRI. Painless and a good diagnostic test. MRI is usually performed if suspicions show on ultrasound. MRI expensive and I think ultrasound has to warrant for insurance companies to cover. My bilateral cancer was found 07/2004 via mammogram/ultrasound & biopsies and then MRI to determine exact location. Luckily, I am cancer free after lumpectomies and HDR brachytherapy to one side. Good Luck! Please don't postpone testing because of pain. I did not have mammogram for 2 years because of discomfort of test, and if I had put it off any longer, I wouldn't have been so blessed.
Posts.Title: Breast Cnacer and Mammogram

Posts.Content: Hello! I'm 2+ years on Arimidex after bilateral IDC & lumpectomies + HDR brachytherapy to the left - no chemo. I've read that rads or chemo can take up to 5 years to recover from the fatigue completely. On Arimidex, only side effects I've had are thinning hair and swelling of the knuckles in my (L) pinkie and first to fingers on my right hand. I finally gave in to the joint pain and take Mobic (non steroid anti-inflammatory) and it's much, much better. Hate taking an Rx to offset an Rx, but since I type a lot, that's probably aggravating the joints too. And, just about to turn 65 so plain old arthritis probably rearing it's head. But, I'd say blinding headache after first starting another inhibitor isn't good. If I had multiple problems, I'd try Femara or another inhibitor. And, from the road we've traveled, this is just a nuisance to be overcome. Good Luck!
Posts.Title: Changing From Arimidex to Aromasin

Posts.Content: I was diagnosed with bilateral IDC in July 2004. After MUCH reading and web searching for information, I selected CTCA in Tulsa for my options and treatment ("We fight cancer, that's all we do"). I was VERY fortunate - after many, many tests, I opted for bilateral lumpectomies. Had not gone to the lymph nodes, so had brachytherapy radiation to the (L) only; the right was 'well defined' in the original MRI, and left was stage 2, right stage 1. My son (35) was freaking out and said 'just get the surgery, Mother...NOW'. The first 2 surgeons (general surgeons, I might add) said double radical mastectomies followed by chemotherapy. After I sought the 3rd opinion at CTCA and ALL the tests were completed, this extreme treatment did not seem to be necessary. Survival and recurrence rates would be the same based on all the tests run. HOWEVER, my son did write me a note saying "if I were the general in this war, I'd grab the biggest guns in the arsenal. But, I'm not. And I won't be the one to pick up the pieces after the battle is over. Make this decision for yourself, Mother. You've put us ahead of yourself all of our lives - put yourself first this time and do what you feel is right in your heart". Thus, I proceeded with my surgeries and treatment with the blessing of my family - the "strongest gun in the arsenal". Just support whatever decision she makes - that's all you can do.
Posts.Title: Help For my Mother

Posts.Content: Leo: 4 years have passed and you cannot wait for the 'other shoe to drop'. TRUST the treatment her Drs. are recommending, and encourage her to keep current with follow-up tests. None of us has a guarantee 'it' won't return...We just have to have faith that it won't. IF it does, believe me, once you've been down this road it's not nearly as terrifying as the 1st time. You're prepared to FIGHT AGAIN. As a bilateral breast cancer survivor with surgery and radiation since 08/04, I give my destiny to God. He intervened and saved me for a purpose; not sure of His plan, but I'm ready for anything he wants to send my way. Keep your Faith. I'll light a candle for your Mom. Be there for her no matter what the future holds. Faith, FAMILY, and friends are the strongest arsenal against Cancer - and it can be beaten.
Posts.Title: Her-2, Ki67, P53...

Posts.Content: I was diagnosed 07/04 with bilateral infiltrating ductal carcinoma. Stage 1 on (L)1.4 cm and stage (2) on right 2.5 cm. Referred to 2 surgeons - both said radical mastectomies, chemo and radiation. HER test not in at this point. Went online and surfed the web for days for information finding out what exactly the pathology reports from needle biopsies really meant. Treatment options seemed available even though both surgeons locally said no. Went online to CTCA website and then to Tulsa for 3rd opinon. To make long story short, bilateral lumpectomies done - lymph nodes both sides clear. Had HDR brachytherapy for 5 days to the left breast - as it turned out, smaller tumor involved more surrounding than right. No chemo necessary; now on Arimidex. Just returned from 6 month checkup - cancer free and doing great. GET A 3RD OR 4TH OPINION...you must be comfortable with the treatment plan. I know I was very lucky, but I had to have all the answers and options in front of me before I could make a decision on what was right for my. I'll keep you in my prayers. If you have options, study them all thoroughly, THEN make your decision.
Posts.Title: Do Not Want a Mastectomy

Posts.Content: Dear Cancer Victim: A bad diet which includes: grains / wheat (white flour), corn, possibly beer, processed white sugar, and white rice, and processed foods with their preservatives and other things we can’t pronounce (the already made kind so easy and so unhealthy that all your friendly grocery stores are so willing to sell you and well stocked on their shelves). I personally have many DEAD family members the last was Jennifer my sister-in-law who was only 25 with a 1 year old son died March 15, 2002 who died from cancer. Jennifer was treated at the Mayo Clinic with the only three ways medical science knows: surgery, chemo and radiation (chop, poision and burn as the cancer patients call it). I also have no female organs, appendix or gall bladder because I USED TO listen to the doctors, if I would have known about Dr. Holland and Doug Kaufmann and their books I would still have all my parts and be a lot healthier and happier. Also The Cancer Treatment Centers of America are good: www.cancercenter.com even though they may use surgery, chemo and radiation (if absolutely necessary) but they also use immune building methods that have saved lots of people who were told there is nothing else to do but die. Personally I would go to Dr. Holland and see what he had to say first. I would trust him the most. Maybe he could consult with doctors at The Cancer Treatment Centers of America if it was necessary to go there. Also a must for cancer victims especially breast cancer!! Dr. Lorraine Day, medical doctor who cured her own breast cancer entirely with alternative medicine!!! No surgery and No chemo or radiation! Videos: "You Can't Improve on God", "Cancer Doesn't Scare Me Anymore" My prayers will go up for you and I pray you choose LIFE and that more abundantly and that God will bless your efforts and you go to the media with lots of information IF you are cured so that others will know about alternative cures that they may also LIVE! If you receive that cure I hope you go to the media (radio, tv and your local newspaper) with lots of information on HOW you were cured so that others will know about alternative choices that are available and that really do cure diseases so that many more may also LIVE and not DIE! If I had cancer I would invest in all the knowledge you will receive with the information available on this letter. More important links if you eat meat: For Natural Grass Fed Beef - Dry Aged Steaks go to: http://brcsuperstore.com/listings/311.html also: http://www.texasgrassfedbeef.com and: http://storesense01.dynamic.net/grassland/index.html Information on all kinds of health subjects: http://www.mercola.com/article/statins.htm - STOP ALL SUGAR IMMEDIATELY!!! That means all sweeteners including all forms of sugar like fructose, sucralose etc., corn syrup, and all others. Read labels as corn syrup is in a LOT of things including Ketchup etc. READ LABELS! Eat ONLY STEVIA (an herb), which you can find at health food stores, locally and on the internet. I would not even use HONEY the only other safe sweetener until my cancer was 100% gone, but that would be my option due to the fact that fungal and cancer tumors alike feed on SUGAR! Which also means stop all carbs made from flour that turns into sugar in your body. No bread, pasta, cake, cereal, white rice etc. Get the books they explain WHY. another cancer article link: http://www.mercola.com/2000/oct/8/sugar_cancer.htm I am sending this because I really do care that too many people are lied to about what cancer really is and that a cure is still being researched, there is no research needed they already KNOW how to cure cancer, if your doctor sincerely doesn't know HOW or where to find the information give him this letter. May God Bless your endeavor for a cure. Remember the Holy Bible says: "My people are destroyed for lack of knowledge." - Hosea 4:6 YOU ARE NOW EQUIPPED WITH LOTS OF KNOWLEDGE AND SOURCES TO FIND KNOWLEDGE USE THEM WISELY! Serving Our Precious Saviour the Lord Jesus Christ who is the answerer of PRAYER! Kristie F. - Michigan
Posts.Title: Do Not Want a Mastectomy

Posts.Content: Chrissy123: Sorry to be so long off the board. WAY TO GO with taking tips and shortcuts learned by those that travel ahead of you. Keep up with education and research and you'll find all kinds of 'tricks' the Drs. and nurses don't know - it comes from experience, and there are millions of survivors out here willing to share. If you have any specific questions, post on www.breastcancer.org and you get lots and lots of responses. It's a very active site and filled with good advice. Best of Luck on your journey!
Posts.Title: Help...scared of Pain During Radioactive Dye Injections

Posts.Content: They gave me some lidocaine cream the night before and instructions were to heavily coat the entire auroeal (sp?)area and around it also a couple of hours prior to the injection. Then, they deaden with several small injections of (Lidocaine?)and it was just a stinging sensation, sort of like a dentist does - then they waited a few minutes and then injected the dye. There was the stinging, I grant you, but is was over in a couple of minutes. With the dye injection, the area was numb and I didn't feel a thing. I think the secret is HEAVILY coating with the cream before any of the procedure starts. And, again, this isn't pleasant, but it passes very quickly. Good luck!
Posts.Title: Help...scared of Pain During Radioactive Dye Injections

Posts.Content: Chrissy123: Sorry to be so long off the board. WAY TO GO with taking tips and shortcuts learned by those that travel ahead of you. Keep up with education and research and you'll find all kinds of 'tricks' the Drs. and nurses don't know - it comes from experience, and there are millions of survivors out here willing to share. If you have any specific questions, post on www.breastcancer.org and you get lots and lots of responses. It's a very active site and filled with good advice. Best of Luck on your journey!
Posts.Title: Help...scared of Pain During Radioactive Dye Injections

Posts.Content: Sorry, I forgot. NEVER refuse an Rx they offer for pain or anxiety! Make everything as easy on yourself as possible!
Posts.Title: Help...scared of Pain During Radioactive Dye Injections

Posts.Content: PLEASE contact CTCA for information. There are 3 facilities currently - Seattle, WA, Tulsa, OK, and Zion Il - the 4th in Philadelphia to open soon. I went through a similar experience last year - bilateral infiltrating ductal carcinoma and was sent to a surgeon immediately after biopsies. He said bilateral radical mastectomies with chemo. Got second opinion, another surgeon, same recommendation. I wondered when the oncologist would be recommended? LOTS & LOTS of information on the internet and recommendations did not agree with pathology from biopsies - left was 1 cm stage 2, right was 2.5 cm stage 1. HER results were not in. Breast cancer centers of America (not CTCA) had article showing 'we are way OVERTREATING breast cancer - chemotherapy should not always be automatic'. I was devastated and felt so alone. Then, I remembered (divine intervention?) a TV advertisement for CTCA "we're here for you 24 hrs a day, 7 days a week". Went to their website and their home page shows "We fight cancer - that's all we do". That was the place for me! I didn't want a general surgeon to operate on a gall bladder, remove both my breasts, then on to an appendectomy. I wanted CANCER experts. You'll find it at CTCA as well as the most caring enthusiastic staff you'll ever encounter. There were patients there (I went to Tulsa) from Mayo Clinic, M D Anderson, etc that had given up hope - and they couldn't say enough for the support and treatment they received at CTCA. Good Luck and you'll certainly be in my prayers as all who have follwed me are daily. I was Blessed - lumpectomies and HDR brachytherapy on the Left, only. NO CHEMO was necessary. Given Arimidex Rx and am Cancer free at 6 months and annual exam coming up in July. Cancer can be beaten. But you need the 3 Fs - Faith, Family and Friends. Their support will be invaluable as you take up the fight. Remember, treatments available now (HDR brachytherapy) were not available 3 short years ago! Not approved for breat cancer treatment by the FDA until 2002. So, take advantage of all information, ASK QUESTIONS, and be comfortable with your treatment options and physicians. Again, God Bless you.
Posts.Title: Diagnosed 2 Weeks Ago

Posts.Content: You live in PA? Call Cancer Treatment Centers of America in Philadelphia TODAY! Don't wait 2 months. Your body is sending you strong signals to act now. Good Luck!
Posts.Title: Anyone With Major Contour Changes in One Breast?

Posts.Content: Go, RUN, to your nearest breast imaging facility. Radiologists will help you with digital mammogram, ultrasound, biopsy if indicated, and MRI. DON'T, PLEASE DON'T fall off the chart for indifference of a physican or PA/RN. TAKE CHARGE OF YOUR LIFE and insist on tests, tests, tests!
Posts.Title: Ladies With Breastcancer
